Article Title: Anil Kapoor: How this 'court case' resulted in Anil Kapoor making it to Time’s list of most Influential people in AI
Article Text:
Why Anil Kapoor featured in the Time Magazine’s AI 2024 list

Implications of Anil Kapoor’s victory



When Hollywood actors had a problem with AI

Time Magazine ’s 2024 list of most Influential people in AI had a surprise inclusion this year. Among prominent names like Google’s Sundra Pichai, Nvidia’s Jensen Huang, OpenAI’s Sam Altman, the list featured bollywood actor Anil Kapoor that came as a surprise to many. So much so that it has got the internet talking and wondering how Anil Kapoor made it to TIME magazine’s AI cover.If you are also curious to know the reason behind Kapoor’s inclusion in the list, then read on.Back in 2023, Kapoor filed a case with the Delhi High Court seeking protection of his own name, image, likeness, persona, voice and various other attributes of his personality against misuse of all hues over the internet. Delivered by Justice Prathiba M Singh, the high court passed an interim order then, restraining the misuse of the actor's name, image, voice and other attributes of persona, including his popular ‘jhakaas’ catchphrase.Reacting to the order, Kapoor then told Variety, “I’m very happy with this court order, which has come in my favor, and I think it’s very progressive and great for not only me but for other actors also.”“Because of the way technology and the AI technology, which is which is evolving every day [and] which can completely take advantage of and be misused commercially, as well as where my image, voice, morphing, GIFs and deep fakes are concerned, I can straight away, if that happens, send a court order and injunction and they have to pull it down,” he said.“Around the same time that SAG-AFTRA members were fighting big Hollywood studios over the use of their AI replicas without consent and compensation, one of India’s most famous actors was fighting a similar battle. Anil Kapoor won a landmark victory in a New Delhi high court in September over unauthorized AI use of his likeness,” says Time Magazine.Anil Kapoor knocked the court’s door when deepfake videos of popular Indian actors including Alia Bhatt, Rashmika Mandanna, Aamir Khan and Ranveer Singh alarmed the country. Kapoor’s victory has also paved the way for others to seek protection over their personality rights .In July this year, the Bombay High Court granted interim relief to singer Arijit Singh, noting that using his voice without permission was a legal violation. The case was heard after unauthorized AI platforms mimicked Singh’s name and likeness without consent, with one platform even using text-to-speech software to convert text into his voice.In 2023, the Screen Actors Guild – American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) demanded to limit the use of AI. The union then sought to ensure actors are informed if artificial intelligence systems were replicating their voices or performances.“It is with profound disappointment that we report the industry CEOs have walked away from the bargaining table after refusing to counter our latest offer,” SAG-AFTRA said in a statement. “These companies refuse to protect performers from being replaced by AI, they refuse to increase your wages to keep up with inflation, and they refuse to share a tiny portion of the immense revenue YOUR work generates for them,” the actors’ guild added.
Article Summary: Time Magazine’s 2024 list of most Influential people in AI had a surprise inclusion this year. Among prominent names like Google's Sundra Pichai and Nvidia's Jensen Huang, the list featured bollywood actor Anil Kapoor. Back in 2023, Kapoor filed a case with the Delhi High Court seeking protection of his own name, image, likeness, persona, voice and various other attributes of his personality.

Article Title: Philips appoints Bharath Sesha as managing director for Indian subcontinent
Article Text: Philips appoints Bharath Sesha as Managing Director for the Indian subcontinent from September 1, 2024. He will lead Philips' healthcare business and operations across several cities. Sesha takes over from Daniel Mazon, now in a global role. His mission includes enhancing healthcare accessibility and affordability in India.
Article Summary: Philips appoints Bharath Sesha as Managing Director for the Indian subcontinent from September 1, 2024. He will lead Philips' healthcare business and operations across several cities. His mission includes enhancing healthcare accessibility and affordability in India. He takes over from Daniel Mazon, now in a global role.

Article Title: Explained: What its Google Photos classic search feature and how to use it
Article Text:
How to use classic search

Open Google Photos: Launch the Google Photos app on your Android or iOS device. Tap the search bar: You'll find it at the top of the screen. Enter your search term: Type in a keyword or phrase related to the photos you're looking for. For example, you could search for "dog," "beach," or "2023." Refine your search: If you're not getting the desired results, try using more specific keywords or combining them with filters.

Tips for effective classic search:

Use relevant keywords: The more specific your keywords, the more accurate your search results will be.

Combine keywords: Use AND, OR, and NOT to combine keywords and refine your search. For example, "dog AND beach" will find photos of dogs at the beach.

Utilise filters: Google Photos offers various filters to help you narrow down your search. You can filter by date, people, places, and more.

Google Photos Classic Search is a powerful tool that allows you to quickly and easily find specific photos and videos within your library. Unlike the newer "Ask Photos" feature, Classic Search uses traditional keyword-based search to locate images.Note: While Classic Search is still a valuable tool, Google Photos' newer "Ask Photos" feature offers more advanced search capabilities using natural language queries.You may want to try both methods to find the best results for your needs.
Article Summary: Google Photos Classic Search is a powerful tool that allows you to quickly and easily find specific photos and videos within your library. Unlike the newer "Ask Photos" feature, Classic Search uses traditional keyword-based search to locate images. Google Photos offers various filters to help you narrow down your search.

Article Title: ICICI Bank warns customers: Lottery frauds always start with …
Article Text: ICICI Bank has issued a warning to its customers about lottery scams where cybercriminals promise large sums of money. The bank advises against sharing sensitive information and stresses that legitimate lotteries do not require advance payments. Customers are encouraged to report such frauds immediately and follow safety tips provided by the bank.
Article Summary: ICICI Bank has issued a warning to its customers about lottery scams. The bank advises against sharing sensitive information and stresses that legitimate lotteries do not require advance payments. Customers are encouraged to report such frauds immediately and follow safety tips provided by the bank.

Article Title: How next ChatGPT AI chatbot may be 'better' than current version
Article Text:
The next GPT model may called “GPT-Next”

GPT-Next created to help humans

ChatGPT-maker OpenAI may be ready to take a leap towards AI dominance with its next AI language model. According to OpenAI Japan CEO Tadao Nagasaki, the next version of ChatGPT is projected to be 100 times more powerful than its predecessor, GPT-4, which currently powers the AI chatbot.As per reports, the model will use a smaller version of OpenAI’s alleged Project Strawberry that was purportedly teased by company CEO Sam Altman last month by means of a photograph of strawberries.Project Strawberry, which is also known as Project Q* (or Q-star) is reportedly a secretive project, which aims to achieve Artificial General Intelligence (AGI).In a gathering at the KDDI Summit 2024, Nagasaki said that the AI model may be called GPT-Next without giving a launch timeline. He said that the new AI model will be announced in the future. It will have a significant advancement in AI capabilities such as improved problem-solving, communication, and insights across various sectors, the CEO added.As per reports, the powerful performance of GPT-Next is due to better architecture and not huge computing resources. GPT-Next's may also have an impact in sectors like healthcare, finance, media and manufacturing. It's poised to accelerate drug discovery, personalise medical treatments, and even transform content creation.As per Nagasaki, the GPT-Next is designed to augment human intelligence, enabling individuals to work more efficiently and creatively.Recently, the company announced that by the end of August, ChatGPT had surpassed 200 million active users – making it the fastest software to reach that milestone. Nagasaki also emphasised the progress in AI and OpenAI's commitment to accelerating its integration into daily life.
Article Summary: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI may be ready to take a leap towards AI dominance with its next AI language model. According to OpenAI Japan CEO Tadao Nagasaki, the next version of ChatGPT is projected to be 100 times more powerful than its predecessor, GPT-4. The model will use a smaller version of OpenAI’s alleged Project Strawberry.

Article Title: Canva explains increasing prices of its AI feature plans by up to 300%
Article Text:
Take a look at the post here

Rise in Canva Teams plan prices in some markets



What the company said



Canva recently announced major price hikes for Canva Teams customers. Some markets, like the US, saw team plan prices increase by up to 300%. The popular design platform has claimed that the cost of generative AI is a contributing factor to this price hike . However, some users have criticised the hike to be excessive. Here are the new prices of Canva Teams plans in some markets.In a post on social media platform X, a user named Will Sanders shared the new prices and wrote: “Canva price increase is one of the biggest increases I have ever seen YoY.”In the US, the annual cost for a Canva Teams plan for five users has increased by nearly 316% from $119.99 to $500 (with a 40% discount for the first year).This discount will also apply to new members that will be added in that period.Meanwhile, in Australia, the company increased monthly fees for five-member plans which used to cost 39.99 AUD to $13.50 AUS per user, which is almost a 70% increase (considering getting the plan for five members from the previous price. It's important to note the plan now charges $13.50 per user per month, with a three-user minimum.Canva Teams plans now cost $100 per person annually or $10 monthly and at least three users are required for a Teams plan. These new rates, previously introduced for new customers, are now being applied to existing subscribers with older pricing plans. However, these changes will not affect Canva’s Pro or Enterprise tiers.In a statement to TechCrunch, a Canva spokesperson confirmed the recent price increases and attributed them to the company's growing suite of generative AI tools, such as Magic Studio .“Our original pricing reflected the early stage of this product and has remained unchanged for the last four years. We’re now updating the price for customers on this older plan to reflect our expanded product experience,” the spokesperson said.The spokesperson noted that some Canva customers were benefiting from lower pricing plans that are no longer available. Its also important to note that Canva adjusted its Teams pricing to $10 per month per user earlier this year.
Article Summary: Canva recently announced major price hikes for Canva Teams customers. Some markets, like the US, saw team plan prices increase by up to 300%. The popular design platform has claimed that the cost of generative AI is a contributing factor to this price hike.

Article Title: India ‘beats’ US in 5G, HDFC Bank’s Apple ‘break’, TCS-Google deal and more tech news of the week
Article Text:
India beats US to become the world’s second-largest market for 5G smartphones; here’s what driving the growth



IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw, Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani, Anil Kapoor and other Indians in Time Magazine's 100 most influential people in AI



HDFC Bank has taken 'temporary break' from its Apple iPhone partnership, bank says 'you can judge the quality of relationship by ...'



TCS expands decade-long partnership with Google Cloud, launches new AI security products



Cognizant is selling the building that has been its headquarters for over 20 years



Employee union president to Infosys: ‘will not hesitate to organize a protest’..if joining date is breached



Delhi High Court warns Wikipedia: “If you don't like India…..”



Adani Group partners Israel's Tower Semiconductor to build $10 billion chip plant in India: All details



Bluetooth version 6.0 is now available: What’s new in the next-gen specification



Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50



SAP CTO Juergen Mueller resigns over ‘inappropriate’ behaviour; read his statement



Intel is giving up on one of its biggest plans announced years ago, here’s why it means a major change



Ban on Elon Musk’s X in Brazil continues: Supreme Court panel backs the order



This week saw India take the centre in the global tech arena by becoming the world's second-largest market for 5G smartphones and having several contributors being recognized on Time's list of influential AI figures . On the other hand, HDFC Bank paused its iPhone partnership with Apple, while TCS expanded its collaboration with Google Cloud and introduced new AI security products.The Adani Group also announced plans to build a $10 billion chip plant in India with Israel's Tower Semiconductor . Other notable events included Wikipedia receiving a warning from the Delhi High Court and the latest Bluetooth technology version being released. All this and more in this week’s TOI-Gadgets Now weekly tech wrapIndia has overtaken the United States to become the world's second-largest market for 5G smartphones, according to a new report from Counterpoint Research. China maintains its position as the top market globally.The report reveals that global 5G handset shipments grew 20% year-over-year in the first half of 2024, with 5G devices now accounting for over 50% of all smartphone shipments for the first time. India experienced the fastest growth among major markets, with 5G shipments surging 60% compared to the first half of 2023. Click here to read more Time Magazine has released its 2024 list of the most influential people in AI. The list highlights the most impactful figures in the field of artificial intelligence (AI). Among the distinguished Indians featured on the list is Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister of Electronics and Information Technology.Highlighting Vaishwnaw’s role in driving India's AI strategy, Time wrote “Under Vaishnaw’s leadership, the country hopes to become one of the top five nations for semiconductor manufacturing—a key component for modern AI systems—within the next five years. Construction has begun in several factories. Yet, Vaishnaw faces significant challenges in realizing these ambitions. India's tech sector struggles with low private R&D investment and a lack of advanced manufacturing ecosystems. Its educational system is also catching up to produce the specialized workforce needed for cutting-edge AI and semiconductor development.”HDFC Bank has temporarily suspended its partnership with iPhone maker Apple, citing cost-to-income considerations. The move comes after a five-year collaboration that offered exclusive cashback and EMI benefits to HDFC Bank credit card holders on Apple products.Parag Rao, Group Head of Payments, Consumer Finance, Marketing, and Liability Product Group at HDFC Bank, told Business Standard, "We have taken a temporary break from our partnership with Apple." He explained that the bank regularly reviews its partnerships, and in this case, the cost-to-income measure no longer aligns with its objectives.The partnership, which began in 2019, made HDFC Bank the sole banking partner for Apple's promotional offers in India. With the suspension, Apple has now partnered with American Express, Axis Bank, and ICICI Bank to offer similar benefits, according to the company's website. Click here to read more Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) has announced an expansion of its partnership with Google Cloud to launch two new AI-powered cybersecurity solutions aimed at strengthening enterprise cyber resilience.The new offerings include TCS Managed Detection and Response (MDR) and TCS Secure Cloud Foundation. Both solutions leverage Google Cloud's security capabilities and TCS's industry expertise to help businesses combat advanced threats and secure cloud environments.The TCS MDR solution, powered by the Google Security Operations platform, enables security teams to detect and respond to threats more quickly. It provides continuous security monitoring and round-the-clock response capabilities. Read the full story here IT major Cognizant is selling its long-standing Indian headquarters in Chennai. The property, located on Chennai's IT Corridor in Okkiyam Thoraipakkam, includes a 15-acre land parcel and 400,000 square feet of office space. As per real estate industry estimates, the property could fetch around Rs 750 crore to Rs 800 crore to the company.The Thoraipakkam office has been Cognizant’s India headquarters for more than 20 years. It is where Cognizant co-founders – Lakshmi Narayanan and Chandrasekaran operated from. It is also the site of a landmark event where the company remotely rang the Nasdaq opening bell, marking a significant milestone in its growth. The campus also represents Cognizant's first fully owned property in Chennai, a step up from its previous rented space in the CSI building near the US Consulate. Click here to read more Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) president Harpreet Singh Saluja said that the Pune-based union will not hesitate to organize a protest in front of Infosys office if there is any breach in the joining date, reports Economic Times. According to the offer letter, the company has asked 1,000 freshers whose joining had been delayed for over two years to join on October 7, 2024. Read the full story here The Delhi High Court recently issued a strict ultimatum to Wikipedia in India. The court warned that it will issue an order to block the online encyclopeadia in India. Justice Navin Chawla, presiding over the case, issued a contempt notice to Wikipedia and delivered a stern warning to the company.Justice Chawla gave the warning during a hearing related to a defamation case filed by the news agency ANI against Wikipedia. The High Court has summoned an authorised representative from Wikipedia to appear in person at the next hearing in October. Click here to read more India's richest man Gautam Adani is joining the global semiconductor race. According to a report in Bloomberg, the Adani Group plans to build a semiconductor fabrication plant with Israeli company Tower Semiconductor. The move aims to bolster India’s chipmaking capabilities as semiconductors become a key geopolitical battleground globally. The deal also gives the Israeli chipmaker a foothold in one of the world's key emerging markets. In the past few years, semiconductors have grown into a crucial resource amid an escalating tech rivalry between the US and China. This has made several nations review their dependency on imports and invest heavily in developing domestic capabilities.Maharashtra deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis announced the same in a post on X, formerly Twitter. The unit is expected to have a production capacity of 40,000 wafers in the first phase, and 80,000 wafers in the second, Fadnavis said in the post. He further added that the plant will create 5000 jobs. He, however, did not share any timeline for the project, but the report quoting sources said that the plant will be built over three to five years. Read the full story here The Bluetooth Special Interest Group (SIG) has released the latest version of the Bluetooth Core Specification, version 6.0. Bluetooth’s last major update was in 2016 when version 5 was announced. Subsequent versions have also made debuts with incremental updates.This latest Bluetooth version 6 brings a host of new features and improvements, aimed at enhancing the capabilities and performance of Bluetooth technology. The new features include a new centimetre-level tracking feature that can improve the Find My networks from companies like Apple and Google. Click here to read more Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts, according to the report, is part of the company's broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments.Layoffs.fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024. Read the full story here AP SE’s Chief Technology Officer (CTO) Juergen Mueller will leave the company by the end of September. Reason: Inappropriate conduct at a company event. SAP CEO Christian Klein will assume responsibility for most of the technology and innovation board area that Mueller currently leads. The company, as well as Mueller, didn't say anything more about what exactly was the ‘inappropriate’ behaviour. Click here to read more Intel is cancelling the development of its 20A process node, which was expected to be used for the production of upcoming Arrow Lake processors. Instead it plans to go with external manufacturers to produce the chips externally. Intel will now rely on outside foundries, likely TSMC, to produce all Arrow Lake components while Intel will handle final packaging.The cancellation of 20A is particularly notable as Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger had positioned it as the start of the company's "Angstrom era" when first announced in 2021. Now, the shift to external manufacturing for Arrow Lake is a significant departure from those plans, but it aligns with the company’s recent cost-cutting measures announced following concerning financial results last quarter. The company is undergoing major restructuring, including laying off 15,000 workers, amid financial challenges.Intel first demonstrated the Arrow Lake chips on 20A wafers at its Innovation 2023 event. At the time, Intel targeted a 2024 release for Arrow Lake.Intel CFO Dave Zinsner said the company would "skip over productizing" the 20A node to reduce capital expenditures. Resources previously allocated to 20A development will now be directed toward the more advanced 18A node, slated for 2025 launch. The company projects the change will save $500 million by avoiding costs associated with ramping up 20A production. Read the full story here The Brazilian Supreme Court panel affirmed the decision of one of its judges to ban Elon Musk's social media platform X nationwide, as stated on the court's website.Last week, Brazil’s Supreme Court imposed a ban on X (formerly known as Twitter). A Supreme Court Judge ordered the platform’s suspension after a months-long standoff over disinformation in South America’s largest nation.The panel, which met virtually, consisted of five of the full bench's 11 justices, including de Moraes, who mandated the platform's suspension for failing to appoint a local legal representative as required by law. The platform will remain blocked until it adheres to his orders and pays the outstanding fines, which as of last week totalled over $3 million, according to his ruling. Click here to read more HP Victus Special Edition laptops launched in India, price starts at Rs 65,999HP has expanded its product lineup with the launch of its new Victus Special Edition laptops. Designed for students the PCs are equipped with the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050A 4GB Laptop GPUs. The company has also revealed that the PCs pack 12th Gen Intel Core processors. Read the full story here
Article Summary: India has overtaken the United States to become the world's second-largest market for 5G smartphones. HDFC Bank has temporarily suspended its partnership with iPhone maker Apple. TCS expanded its collaboration with Google Cloud and introduced new AI security products. Wikipedia received a warning from the Delhi High Court and the latest Bluetooth technology version was released.

Social media platform, X (formerly known as Twitter) has announced that it is actively hiring for roles within its security and safety teams. This comes after a period of significant layoffs that began in 2022. According to the job posting, the company is seeking to hire employees to assist with content moderation and platform security .As reported by TechCrunch, X posted multiple job openings in the last month.All the job openings were divided between its safety and cybersecurity teams. Safety team positions range from director of strategic response to government affairs managers. On the cybersecurity side, X is seeking to hire several security engineers and a threat intelligence specialist.This rehiring effort marks a significant shift in X's strategy and could signal a renewed focus on user safety and well-being. It remains to be seen how these new hires will impact the platform's overall approach to content moderation and user protection.To recall, in April 2023, Musk told the BBC that Twitter's workforce had been reduced by 6,000 employees in just six months, leaving only around 1,500 employees remaining after the layoffs were completed.Salary Range: $154,000-259,000 USDX serves our community of users and customers by working tirelessly to preserve free expression and choice, create limitless interactivity, and create a marketplace that enables the economic success of all its participants.You will be responsible for helping maintain the security of X’s networks, products, offices, and data centers. You will help identify and manage risks and work with partner teams to reduce and manage them. You will secure, advocate, and help build secure-by-default systems and infrastructure that close off entire classes of security problems.You care about security and building a secure environment for the people using X everyday. You are curious, comfortable digging into the details, have experience with the tools of the trade, and are eager to help others protect our systems. Ideally, you have many of the following (but need not have all):
Article Summary: Social media platform, X (formerly known as Twitter) has announced that it is actively hiring for roles within its security and safety teams. This comes after a period of significant layoffs that began in 2022. According to the job posting, the company is seeking to hire employees to assist with content moderation and platform security.

Article Title: Did Pavel Durov went under the knife? His transformation raises eyebrows
Article Text:
Pavel Durov's rise to fame

Durov's recent legal troubles

Pavel Durov’s transformation: Then vs. Now

Social media reactions on Durov’s transformation

Impact of public scrutiny

Also read

Pavel Durov, CEO of Telegram , has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance. Adding to the intrigue, Durov was recently arrested in France, raising further questions about the man behind the popular messaging app.Pavel Durov, a 39-year-old entrepreneur originally from Russia, is best known as the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013.Telegram quickly gained popularity for its strong emphasis on user privacy, offering end-to-end encryption and other security features that set it apart from competitors. As of now, Forbes estimates Durov's net worth to be around $15.5 billion. Despite his success in the tech industry, Durov has managed to maintain a relatively low profile—until now.Durov's recent arrest in Paris has added a new layer of complexity to his public image. He was detained in France on charges of suspected complicity in running an online platform involved in illicit activities, including child exploitation, drug trafficking, and fraud. While these allegations are serious, it is the sudden focus on Durov's physical transformation that has captured the internet's attention.Pavel Durov has been active on social media platforms like Instagram since 2011, regularly sharing photos from his travels around the world. In his recent posts, Durov appears with a full head of hair and a toned physique, often posing shirtless in various locations. However, these recent images stand in stark contrast to older photos where Durov was seen with a noticeably receding hairline.The drastic change in his appearance has fueled rumours that Durov may have undergone plastic surgery, including a possible hair transplant. A popular post on X (formerly Twitter) by a well-known account shared a side-by-side comparison of Durov's old and new photos, sparking a flurry of online discussions. The post reads, "Pavel Durov (Telegram CEO) before his hair transplant and plastic surgery," and has since gone viral.The speculation around Durov's transformation has been met with a variety of opinions online. On Reddit, users have debated whether the changes in Durov's appearance are the result of surgical procedures or simply better grooming and styling.One Reddit user commented, "This isn't a hair transplant. His hair is too thick and full to have this kind of drastic change from a HT. Most likely he's wearing a hair system (wig)."Another user added, "There's speculation that it's not a transplant, but rather a hair system because his hair loss was much more advanced in the first picture, so when the operation happens, the resulting hairdo never looks as full as his."Some users believe the changes are the result of plastic surgery, with one theorising, "This is well-done surgery."However, not everyone is convinced that surgery is involved. One Reddit user opined, "Honestly, I think a lot of the facial 'changes' are simply due to the much better angle and lighting in the second photo."As the speculation continues, it's clear that Durov's transformation—whether natural or assisted—has caught the public's eye. The intense scrutiny of his appearance highlights the challenges that come with being in the spotlight, especially for someone as private as Durov. Whether or not he has undergone any procedures, the discussions around his looks reflect a broader societal fascination with image and success.
Article Summary: Pavel Durov, 39, is the founder and CEO of Telegram, a messaging app launched in 2013. He has recently become the subject of widespread speculation after older photos of him resurfaced online. These images have led many to wonder whether the billionaire entrepreneur underwent plastic surgery to enhance his appearance.

Article Title: When Tesla CEO Elon Musk called Ratan Tata a “gentleman and …”
Article Text:
Tata Nano and the Indian automobile market

Elon Musk praised Ratan Tata

The legacy of the Tata Nano

Also read

In the realm of business and innovation, few figures command as much respect as Tata Group chairman emeritus Ratan Tata. His influence extends far beyond the Indian corporate world, even garnering admiration from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose , Musk praised Ratan Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar." This moment has recently resurfaced, shedding light on Musk's appreciation for Ratan Tata and his ambitious project, the Tata Nano .The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time). The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. The idea was revolutionary—a small, affordable car that would cater to the vast Indian middle class, providing them with a safe and efficient means of transportation.In the interview with Charlie Rose, which took place shortly after the launch of the Tata Nano, the Tesla CEO was asked about his views on Ratan Tata’s efforts to introduce a low-cost car in India. The interview clip, which has recently gone viral, captures Musk's candid response."Take for a moment Ratan Tata, what he’s doing in India — developing a little sedan for $2300. Where do you put that in the whole equation of where the future of cars is?" asked Rose.Musk responded with a mix of admiration and caution. He began by acknowledging the brilliance behind the Tata Nano project and the character of Ratan Tata himself."I think it's a good idea to have affordable cars, but I think the problem with something like the Nano ... I wouldn't say problem because I think, by the way, it is probably a great idea and Ratan is a gentleman and scholar," Musk said.However, Musk also expressed his concerns about the long-term viability of such a low-cost vehicle, particularly in the context of rising fuel prices. He pointed out that while the initial purchase cost of the Nano was remarkably low, the cost of running the car—particularly fuel costs—could become a significant issue as gasoline prices continued to rise."But where it’s going to become challenging in the future is when the price of gasoline rises, the cost of acquiring the car is much less of an issue than the cost of running the car," the billionnaire explained.Despite the initial excitement surrounding the Tata Nano, the car faced numerous challenges. One of the most significant issues was its branding. While the Nano was intended to be an affordable vehicle for the masses, it was often labeled as "cheap" rather than "affordable." This perception problem, combined with safety concerns and competition from other small cars, led to unimpressive sales figures.The Nano’s production was ultimately discontinued in 2018, marking the end of what was initially seen as a groundbreaking project. The car's journey from inception to discontinuation is often cited as one of the biggest marketing failures in the automobile industry.
Article Summary: The Tata Nano was introduced by Tata Motors in 2008 as the world's cheapest car, with a price tag of just Rs 1 lakh (approximately $2,300 at the time) The car was a pet project of Ratan Tata, designed to make automobile ownership accessible to millions of Indians who had never been able to afford a car. In a 2009 interview with American journalist Charlie Rose, Musk praised Tata as a "gentleman and a scholar"

Article Title: Donald Trump has found a role for Elon Musk in the US government
Article Text: Donald Trump announced his intention to form a government efficiency commission with Elon Musk as its head if he is elected President. The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US-based companies.
Article Summary: The commission will audit the federal government to identify and eliminate fraud and improper payments. Trump also outlined proposals to cut regulations, boost energy production, adopt cryptocurrencies, and reduce corporate taxes for US- based companies. The commission will be headed by Elon Musk if he is elected President.

Article Title: Bengaluru-based Dunzo lays off 75% employees, reduces workforce to 50
Article Text:
Dunzo sends email to employees

Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. Citing unknown sources aware of the matter, the report said that the online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams.The job cuts , according to the report, is part of the company's broader effort to curb costs and create cash flow to address mounting liabilities, including overdue salaries to current and former employees and outstanding vendor payments. Layoffs .fyi - the online tracker show that the job cuts were made on August 31, 2024.As per the report, Dunzo has sent an email to its employees informing them about the recent downsizing. In the letter, Dunzo promises to pay pending salaries, severance, leave encashment, and other dues to affected staff as soon as it secures the necessary funds.Dunzo, which started as a concierge service, has undergone multiple shifts and challenges. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round. In May this year, Dunzo was reportedly close to securing $22-25 million through a mix of equity and debt from both new and existing investors.In mid-July this year, the company informed its employees that it was in the final stages of closing a deal, expecting to settle dues within 10-15 days. However, the transaction failed to materialize with subsequent emails revealing persistent delays and challenges.The company is now seeking to diversify its revenue sources beyond its primary merchant-focused operations.
Article Summary: Reliance Retail-backed Dunzo has laid off 75% of its workforce, reports Financial Express. The online delivery app now has 50 employees in its core supply and marketplace teams. The company, once valued at $775 million, has been struggling to close a critical funding round.

Article Title: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal slams Elon Musk’ X: “just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court”
Article Text:
Take a look at Bhavish Aggarwal’s post on X

Elon Musk criticizes Brazil ban on X



Delhi High Court warns Wikipedia

Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal has once again reiterated his stance on fostering the Indian technology sector. Aggarwal took to microblogging site X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non-compliance with Indian laws.In the post, he wrote “Another proof of why we need to build our tech stack in India. These platforms don’t even comply with Indian laws and then even ignore court judgements!”.But he did not stop there.Aggarwal took aim at Elon Musk 's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident to slam the platform. He said “Also, just look at Twitter’s arm twisting of the Brazilian Supreme Court .”“The more we ignore and justify, more we risk,” he further added.Recently, Brazil Supreme Court banned X after a protracted legal battle. The battle started in April this year when Judge de Moraes directed X to suspend several accounts alleged to be disseminating false information. X's refusal to follow this order resulted in the current suspension in addition to a penalty of 50,000 reais (approximately Rs. 7.47 lakh) for any efforts to bypass the ban, including the use of VPNs.Elon Musk reacted to the announcement with fury, dubbing Moraes as ‘evil dictator’.The Delhi High Court threatened Wikipedia to block the website if it doesn’t comply with India’s laws. Justice Navin Chawla delivered the warning during a hearing related to a defamation case filed by news agency ANI against Wikipedia."If you don't like India, please don't work in India... We will ask government to block your site," Justice Chawla declared, as reported by legal news website Bar and Bench.
Article Summary: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal took to X (formerly known as Twitter) to share his views on the latest report of Delhi High Court slamming Wikipedia over non- compliance with Indian laws. He also took aim at Elon Musk's social media platform, Twitter, leveraging the Wikipedia incident.
